H0.text: The body's immune system attacks specific tissues causes the symptoms of rheumatoid arthritis, an autoimmune disease that affects the joints.

H1.text: The cells of the immune system begin to grow rapidly is the event that causes the symptoms of rheumatoid arthritis, an autoimmune disease that affects the joints.

H2.text: The body's immune system fails to fight off infections causes the symptoms of rheumatoid arthritis, an autoimmune disease that affects the joints.

H3.text: The cells of the immune system are absorbed by antigens is the event that causes the symptoms of rheumatoid arthritis, an autoimmune disease that affects the joints.

A4.text: The underlying mechanism involves the body's immune system attacking the joints.
